text: [Music]
the biggest most impressive thing about
AWS is just the breadth of the offering
whenever I have a problem uh there's a
technology solution that AWS has that
can solve it it's no longer a question
of how are we going to do this it's like
how are we going to leverage AWS to pull
it off my name is Tommy McClung I'm the
chief technology officer at truear so
truear is an online digital Automotive
Marketplace so the mission is to create
a transparent car buying process the
company's about 600 employees we have
about 700 Partners across the country
that we power their car buying service
and all of that is powered by AWS before
moving to AWS our it environment was
based in the data center as well as in
our offices and what we're doing right
now is migrating all of that into the
cloud first it was to get our team
focused on the problem at hand which is
delivering great products to our
customers second it was to get everybody
working on a unified platform uh which
includes a consistent and common set of
Technologies across our applications and
across our infrastructure as we chose
AWS as our cloud provider uh knowing
that there was Premier partners that
would help support us in the migration
to AWS was huge Corp info has really
been key to to meeting all of our
objectives in AWS and really helping us
with the migration and being there when
we're doing all of our project planning
and uh implementation we embedded Corp
info into the team they were on our
devops team they were helping us build
out all of the devops culture and that
then enabled our developers to not
really have to worry as much about it
they just built their applications and
then rolled those into a Docker
container and and off we were to the
races pre AWS we had lots of different
Technologies languages that we were
using and that created a lot of friction
for the team a lot of constraints around
resources a lot of people waiting around
and our ability to leverage AWS to to to
literally let everybody have their own
instance of true car without worrying
about stomping on each other's toes was
a huge motivator for for making the move
everybody at true car actually gets
their own development environment and uh
we quickly and rapidly spin that up by
uh leveraging a technology we built
internally called space pods any
developer coming in can with the push of
a button create their own version of
trar when we looked at what we run in
the data center and then we went and
looked at how would we Implement an AWS
there was an answer for all of it
there's EMR for hop there's Amazon
elastic search for our elastic search
infrastructure we got elastic load
balancers we got ECS we have uh Kinesis
that we're doing all of our log
streaming with and then also we we
realized it was it was way for us to
enable uh rapid prototyping we have a
product where in order to understand
what your vehicle is we need you to type
in a VIN number if you know where it is
on your car it's like a 16-digit alpha
numeric code and it's pretty difficult
so we thought it'd be better if you
could just snap a photo in order to do
that in our data center it would have
taken us 6 months of time to go buy
Hardware just to Tinker around with like
a GPU cluster to do Optical image
recognition we did in about 15 minutes
on AWS by spinning up our own GPU
cluster and testing out a lot of the
libraries that would pull us off for us
so in minutes we can do things that
would take us months to even just see if
it it would work so our experience
working with AWS has been amazing we
have all the technologies that we need
in order to run our applications and run
our business the morale of the team that
are building products you know
exponentially increase so across the
board it's been a phenomenal experience
